title: CalArts logo wide sans
content:
Any Ideas? Do you know of something close? Many Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615191400im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/calarts-over_6233.gif)

 [‹ Font identify](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615191400/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45578 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please Identify this font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615191400/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45644 "Go to next forum topic")
author: JB01

comments.content:
(Bump) I don’t know this one offhand, but this seems like something we should be able to ID.

- Mike Yanega

[Zeppelin 41 Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615191400/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/) would be easy to make into this, with the addition of a few serifs.

- Mike Yanega

After trying to match this to every font categorized as ’wide’at MyFonts, I think I will stick with my previous answer. The only thing significant (to my eye) that distinguishes this sample from Zeppelin 41 Bold is the extra serifs on some of the letters of the sample.

- Mike Yanega

Just to show, that this kind of fonts are existing:  
Elementar  
Norddeutsche Schriftgießerei GmbH, Berlin  
Erstguß 1927  
Hausschnitt

Georg

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615191400im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/1_5410.jpg)

ah... and sorry for the bad quality of example.

Georg

Georg, that typeface has similarities, but it does not match the sample in many details. Nice to hear from you again, as always. Most likely the original of the sample was done digitally, I would suppose.

- Mike Yanega
Knowing CalArts, this is possibly student or teacher work.

It is alumni work. Part of a larger identity system that hasonly partially seen the light of day:

[http://www.adamsmorioka.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080615191400/http:/www.adamsmorioka.com/ "http://www.adamsmorioka.com/")
